sub_title: Principal Scientist at Goodix Technology Netherlands
summary:
Professional  profile:
•	Deep knowledge and research experience in a wide range of applied physics, electronics and interdisciplinary technologies in industrial environments (e.g. MEMS (Micro Electro-Mechanical System), Si devices, electronics, sensors and actuators, Shape Memory Alloy actuator, heat transfer, ultrasound and acoustics, optics and IR, magnetism and magnetic sensors, magnetic materials and thin-film technology, etc.)
•	Experience in algorithm (MATLAB) development, especially for ultrasonic and sensors applications. Experience in application of machine learning for ultrasonic detection
•	Experience in (electronics) systems and system characterizations
•	Experience in physical modeling: analytical & finite element, using e.g. COMSOL, FEMM (Finite Element Method Magnetics), Mathematica, MATLAB etc
•	Experience in silicon device processing (lithography, etching, thin-film deposition, etc.)
•	Very strong experimental skills, especially measurements and characterizations, measurement automation, data analysis (using e.g. Labview, MATLAB/Simulink)
•	Very good abilities to create innovative concepts and hands-on skills in building proof-of-concept demos and applications
•	Strong creativity in generating innovative ideas, owner of >32 granted US patents, awarded Master Inventor title at NXP.  Author and co-author of over 40 scientific publications

awards.title: Invention of the year 2009 - Silver Award

profile_positions.description:
R&D activities:
•	Ultrasound algorithms and applications: Development of algorithms (including applications of Machine Learning), signal processing, and building demos for various airborne ultrasound applications for smartphones.
•	Haptics: Characterizations and algorithm development for Linear Resonant Actuators (transducers used for haptic actuation in smartphones).
•	Sensor fusion for temperature & humidity measurements in smartphones: experiments, measurements and demo creation.
•	Presence detection: development of LongWave InfraRed (LWIR) detection technique, bolometer characterization methodology (building IR optical measurement setup), and experiments on various LWIR applications.
•	Micro-ElectroMechanical Systems (MEMS) timing devices: Characterizations, MEMS design, analytical and finite-element modeling and simulation of MEMS resonators and oscillator systems, development of methods, models, and algorithms for temperature drift compensation, investigations of nonlinearities in MEMS resonators, building MEMS oscillator demos, partial involvement in MEMS processing such as deep reactive-ion-etching and thin-film packaging. Discovered and invented the self-sustained MEMS oscillator concept, which led to a Nature Physics publication.
•	Optical joystick for mobile phones: novel concept creation, modeling and design of device, development of detection algorithms, demo creation.
profile_positions.title: Principal scientist

profile_positions.description:
R&D activities:
•	Elastomer-based magnetoresistive accelerometer: novel concept creation, modeling, simulation, design, development of fabrication process and characterizations of the accelerometer.
•	Tunnel Magnetoresistive (TMR) current sensor for IC testing: modeling (analytical and finite-element), simulation, design, and development of fabrication process, characterizations of TMR current sensors.
•	Magnetic Random Access Memory (MRAM): development of fabrication process for MRAM, characterizations of MRAM cells (electrical and magnetic characterizations).
